705231f-a.title: Brooklyn: Kings Highway - 38th Street (East)
705231f-a.text:
Kings Highway, north side, at East 38th Street, showing the Jeremish Bergen House, erected about 1850, and occupied by his son Theodore in 1922. Now (1936), it is no longer standing. The Bergen farm consisted of about 30 aores. The elder Bergen had three sons, Jerome L., a farmer and engineer, Theodore, a farmer and Edgar, a lawyer Pe also had two daughters, Sarah unmarried and Anna who married Benj. G.
Hitchings, father of the present J. G. Pitchings.
1922.
Eugene L. Armbruster Collection.
The same, from another angle.
1922.
Eugene L. Armbruster Collection.

705233f-a.title: Brooklyn: Kings Highway - 38th Street (East)
705233f-a.text:
(1)
Eings Highway, north side, at East 38th Street, showing the Jeremiah Bergen home, erected in 1850 and accupied by him from 1860 to 1873; and by Theo. Bergen from 1879 to 1923. It was rased December 1925.
1923.
Eugene L. Armbruster Collection.
(2)
The same, from a different angle.
1923.
Eugene L. Armbruster Collection.
(3)
TNe same, another view.
1923.
Eugene L. Armbruster Collection.
